error-message.abrv: The abreviation must contain 3 to 7 characters
error-message.name: The name of the lecture must contain 3 to 500 characters

error-message.question: Question must contain at least 3 characters
error-message.answer: The answer must be between 1 and 1000 characters

dialog.title: Cancel Edit
dialog.content: Are you sure, you want to cancel editing this card? The changes will be discarded.

question: Question

cards.title: Cards
cards.text: Cards is a website designed to help you prepare for you exams. The concept of our website is based on traditional index cards, with the advantage that you don't need to carry your heavy stack of cards around. Our site is optimized for smartphones, allowing you to view your cards wherever you are.
cards.create-account: , to use all features of our website.

sharing-is-caring.title: Sharing is Caring
sharing-is-caring.text-one: The cards you add are automatically visible to other users. Meanwhile you can also look at the cards from other users
sharing-is-caring.text-two: If you are not satisfied with a card, or you think the content is incorrect or incomplete, then you can edit them. Cards, which were added by other users cannot be edited yet.

feedback.title: We care about your feedback
feedback.text-one: We try to avoid mistakes. However, we might have overlooked some of them. Please report them to us by following
feedback.text-three: (you need to have a Github account). We will try to correct them as soon as possible. You can also leave feedback there, or by writing us an
feedback.text-four: . We try to fix the problem ASAP.

cookies.title: About cookies
cookies.text-one: We are using cookies so that you only have to log in once.

where-find-cards.title: Where do I find cards for my lecture?
where-find-cards.text-three: you can find a list of all available lectures. Choose your lecture. If you can't find it, you can add it.
where-find-cards.text-eight: After following the link you will get to the page, on which all cards for the lecture are displayed. You can use the arrow keys, or swiping, to navigate between different cards. The content of a card can be displayed by clicking on "Answer".
where-find-cards.text-nine: You can use the searchbar in the navigation to search for questions.

no-lecture-present.title: My lecture is not contained in the list. How can I add it?
no-lecture-present.text-one: If you can't find your lecture in the list, you can add it by submitting the form ("Add lecture")
no-lecture-present.text-six: After adding the lecture, you will be redirected to a new page where you can add your first card.

how-to-create-card.title: How do I create a card?
how-to-create-card.text-three: a list of lectures is displayed. Choose your lecture. If you can't find your lecture, you can add it by using the form.
how-to-create-card.text-four: After navigating to the lecture page, you can add a new card, by navigating to the  "Add" tab. Fill out the form and submit it.
how-to-create-card.text-nine: , to be become the author of the card. Cards with authors can only be editet by their authors.
how-to-create-card.text-ten: Pro-Tip: You can add latex formiulas, by wrapping them around $ signs. More information about latex can be found

how-to-edit-card.title: How do I edit a card?
how-to-edit-card.text-one: Choose the card which you want to edit. Click on the  "pen" icon. Edit the content in the form and the form. Please note, that only cards with no author, or your own cards, can be editet.

how-to-use-latex.title: How can I use latex?
how-to-use-latex.text-one: Latex is a great tool to write formulas. Start and close your formula  with $-signs und activate the Latex switch. Make sure that the formatting is correct. More information about latex can be found

dialog.title: Report card
dialog.content: Are you sure, you want to report this card?
